intro: Dictyanthus asper, commonly known as the rough dicot, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves, which give it its scientific name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
